page.title: 13Homing Pigeons-Kimblesworth
page.content:
{ Pigeon Racing}
Using the 'homing' instinct of pigeons for mans own interests has been recorded for many years throughout the world. The first record of organised races in Kimblesworth is in the 1880's. These races were called 'Milers' when birds were released singly 1 mile away from a selected spot at set times. The fastest bird to reach and alight on the set area was the winner. The present club 'The Kimblesworth Homing Society' was formed in 1977 and is a member of the Durham Central League. The races vary in distance from 80 miles for birds under 12 months old to the longest of 520 miles from Nantes in France.
